etymologies: early 18th century; earliest use found in Susanna Centilivre (bap. 1664, d. 1723), playwright and actress. From mar- + plot

definitions: A person who or (occasionally) a thing which spoils a plot or hinders the success of any undertaking.

notes.text: In early use allusively as a personification.

definitions: That spoils or defeats a plot or hinders an undertaking.
